events.name: GDG January event: The Android Talk
events.description:
We are back for the new year!

Join our next talk, Thursday 28th January, at Startlab.

We are glad to present our speakers for the day:

- John O'Reilly, Android Software Engineer from Cisco

- Iñaki Villar, Google Developer Expert in Android 

- Dr. Attracta Brennan, Lecturer at NUIG and GMIT 

We will have as well the usual Google Wheel of Names afterwards to announce a winner for a brand new Chrome cast!

We also have a big announcement for a cool event from Google in February, so don't miss that!

Pizza and drinks are available, please RSVP so we can make sure we have enough for all :)

@GDGgalway
https://plus.google.com/116685125720306144483

events.name: Google HashCode Competition
events.description:
Hash Code is a team-based programming competition organized by Google for students and industry professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

We are registered as a hub with NUIG- IT Department. Find your team and sign up from here: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/signup.html choosing NUIG as your hub and writing the email of your team leader (your email if it was you)

Registration is free and open until 9th February 2016
We will be live streaming the competition rules from Google and all the teams around the world will try to solve it at the same time. Read more details on the website: https://hashcode.withgoogle.com
and send us any questions you have ..

events.name: Our Time To Lead: Celebrating International Women Day
events.description:
From Ada Lovelace to Grace Hopper to thousands of Googlers, we're proud of the contributions women in technology have made across our industry. And we're excited by the contributions women continue to make today. Google supports and celebrates women in technology through numerous initiatives. International Women's Day is an important moment to recognize how women have influenced the tech industry and beyond.

Join us 10th March to celebrate International Women Day in a special Women Techmakers Event. 

Women Techmakers is Google's global program and brand for women in technology. Led by a global team of Googlers who are passionate about empowering women in technology through increased visibility, community, and resources.

We launched Women Techmakers in Galway September 2015 powered by Google Developers Group and we are proud to introduce a great list of speakers for the event:

Dr Vania Dimitrova is Associate Professor at the University of Leeds UK where she is a member of the Artificial Intelligence theme at the School of Computing, and Co-Director of the Leeds Research Centre in Digital Learning. Her research is in user-aware intelligent systems, focusing on knowledge-enriched user modelling and adaptation, crowd-wisdom, interactive data exploration, knowledge capture and ontological modelling. She has led research activities in several projects developing user-aware intelligent systems to augment human intellect, involving interdisciplinary partnerships with researchers from Education, Business, Psychology, Engineering and end users from industries (e.g. Ordnance Survey, Rolls Royce, SNCF, various SMEs) and charities (via LeedsACTS!). She has chaired premier international conferences on user modelling and intelligent learning environments, and has served as a member of the editorial boards of major journals in these areas (IEEE TLT, UMIAI, IJAIED).

Gosia Sokolowska is Site Reliability Engineer at Google.  She studied CS and also Control Engineering and Robotics in Poland then moved to Ireland after graduation. She has been at Google for almost 6 years now, on several teams: AdSense Policy, Search Quality and now as a Site Reliability Engineer on Spanner - Google's planet-scale distributed database system. She is also actively engaged in Google's diversity/inclusiveness efforts. Privately, a fitness enthusiast and a lacemaker.


Maricka Burke Keogh is Head of Digital Marketing at Altocloud and founder of OMIG, a business network for the West of Ireland. She was the winner of JCI Galway 'The Outstanding Young Person of the Year Award’ in 2013. She has also previously held positions with ad agency Atomic, IMS Marketing and Google. Over the years, Maricka has worked with large corporate brands ranging from GlaxoSmithKline, PaddyPower, Ladbrokes, and Unilever to working with organisations such as Fine Gael and Leinster Rugby. Based now in Galway, she is responsible for the Digital Marketing Strategy for Altocloud. Maricka's digital marketing specialities lie within the B2B sector for Medical Device, Engineering and ICTs (SaaS based models) sectors. 


Tracy Keogh is Programme Manager at Bank of Ireland's first incubator, Startlab. She is on the board of the Irish Internet Association and runs a number of startup events including co-founding Startup Hiking. 


Mary Loftus is firstly a learner. She spent the last 4 and-a-half years as an IT manager with Stiefel-GSK where she oversaw a €2m IT upgrade of a manufacturing facility. She has been a facilitator and developer of online learning with NUI Galway for the past 9 years, a mentor at CoderDojo Sligo the past 3 years. She is the mother of school-going children and has just completed a term a Primary School Board of Management. She's interested in creating spaces for learning and creativity where learners of all ages can access their deepest and truest potential for growth. She's also interested in spaces where women in IT can make connections and find ways to improve the culture in the industry for all.

All ladies are welcome for 3 hours of inspiring talks, great stories, useful career advice, networking, food and beverages.

Note: Men are welcome as +1's :)

events.name: Join GDG Galway for a great evening at our first I/O Extended
events.description:
What are I/O Extended events?

Google I/O Extended events are focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions, in real-time. 

In 2015, there were:

• 533 I/O Extended events

• in 445 cities

• in 94 countries

• across 6 continents

A successful I/O Extended event...

Connects talented developers giving them the chance to exchange ideas, teach their skills and acquire new ones.

Watching the live stream of the keynote address live from Mountain View, California is part a of our community building. Discovering the latest in Google technologies as they are announced.

We want you, our members, to be a part of our fledgeling history and attend our first I/O Extended.

Spaces are limited and we will only have so much swag, so when its gone, its gone!!

We look forward to seeing you all there!!!

events.name: Build Your First Progressive Web App

venue.name: PorterShed, Galway City Innovation District
venue.address_1: Eqre Square Galway (beside Meyrick + Bus Station)

events.description:
Join our next talk, Wednesday 3rd August, at Portershed in Eyre Square to ensure that you take a close look on the newest trend in web apps and mobile apps world, the new Progressive Web Apps.

We will have a viewing of the "Progressive Web App Dev Summit 2016" along with codelabs and a small tutorial to build your first progressive web app.

Please don't forget to bring your laptops along to enjoy the coding session.

You will for sure enjoy SWAGs, Pizzas, and drinks.
Please RSVP so we can make sure we have enough for all :) 

@GDGgalway https://plus.google.com/116685125720306144483

events.name: On The Tech Road - Find out what life is like in…

venue.name: PorterShed, Galway City Innovation District
venue.address_1: Eqre Square Galway (beside Meyrick + Bus Station)

events.description:
Greetings dear Community!

On The Tech Road - Find out what life is like in…

For Students but also everybody else!

An open evening to all TY, 5th year and 6th Year students to see what life in I.T. is like! We have speakers from Google, Amazon, HPE, Triangle and Blue Tree Systems talking about their journeys so far and their day-to-day roles in high energy, exciting environments. There will also be a speaker from NUI Galway to speak on the different course options available in NUIG. 

SPEAKERS:

- Jillian Kozyra, Search Quality Analyst @ Google

- TDB @ Amazon

- Claire Gallagher, Graduate Software Developer @ Hewlett Packard Enterprises

- Valerie Heatly, End User Compute and Enterprise Mobility Specialist @ Triangle

- Caroline O’Dowd, HR Manager @ Blue Tree Systems

- Fidelma Wallace, Talent Acquisition Manager @ Codec-DSS

- Josephine Griffith, Lecturer in Computer Science/Information Technology & Researcher @ NUI Galway

There will be free Dough Bro's pizza for all, kindly sponsored by Codec-dss, and NUIG goodies. It's a great opportunity to find out if a career in I.T. or Engineering is for you, you'll never know until you find out!

Please share the event with your friends!

We hope to see you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Facing the Hotel Meyrick, continue up the lane to the right of the hotel. The Portershed is located about 500 meters up, at the end on the right hand side. There is free parking available outside.

events.name: Google Hash Code 2017 - sign up today!

venue.name: PorterShed, Galway City Innovation District
venue.address_1: Eqre Square Galway (beside Meyrick + Bus Station)

events.description:
The Google Developers Group Galway will be hosting a Hash Code hub in the PorterShed. We want you to be a part of our event and submit a team today!

We hope to host a diverse collection of teams of varying experience ranging from students to seasoned developers.

Think you could come up with a way to optimize Internet coverage for Project Loon balloons? Or how about routing Google Street View cars through Paris?

Step into the shoes of a Google engineer and tackle these types of challenges during Hash Code, a team-based programming competition for students and professionals (18+) across Europe, the Middle East and Africa organized by Google. You pick your team and programming language, we pick a real-life engineering problem to solve. Are you up for the challenge?

The competition is divided into two stages:

an Online Qualification Round on 23rd February at 18:30 CET For this round, your team can participate from wherever you’d like, including one of our Hash Code hubs. Hubs allow for teams in the same location (eg. city or university) to compete side-by-side in a more fun and exciting environment.a Final Round on 1st April Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to Google Paris to compete in the Final Round of the competition.

Find some teammates and sign up today at g.co/hashcode!

events.name: Docker 4th Birthday Workshop with Tom Barlow

venue.name: PorterShed, Galway City Innovation District
venue.address_1: Eqre Square Galway (beside Meyrick + Bus Station)

events.description:
To celebrate the Docker project's 4th birthday, GDG Galway are teaming up with Tom Barlow of Docker to host an intro to the Docker platform. Open to people of all levels, whether you have used Docker in a working environment before, are looking to learn about it for the first time, or even wondering if it could help assist you in your every day work.

Our event will consist of small challenges with material aimed at beginners and intermediate level developers, and hands-on labs. Experienced Docker users will serve as mentors to help attendees learn during the event.

Hosted in the PorterShed, our doors open at 6pm to start the first workshops at 6:30pm, finishing at 9:00pm with food and coffee supplied throughout. We hope to see you all there, and please feel free to bring along friends and work colleagues.

Agenda:

6:00 - Doors Open

6:30 - Welcome message, presentation of Docker

6:45 - 8:45 - Working session

Labs used during the session will be available at: https://github.com/docker/labs

events.name: Intro to the GO Programming Language
events.description:
**PLACES ARE LIMITED, WE OPERATE ON A FIRST COME FIRST SERVED BASIS**

After the massive success of our Docker Birthday celebrations, the team has organised our next event for developers of all backgrounds around Galway - An Introduction to Go Programming with Michael Hausenblas!

Open to anyone with a background in code, the team has prepared a series of codelabs at beginner and intermediate levels with the aim of introducing developers to #Golang. 

Go is a clean, compiled language with modern features. This will be an opportunity for seasoned developers to showcase some of the projects they have built using Go and we will be examining what local developers are using Go for in Industry.

A team of mentors fluent in Go will be on hand to help and advise, the aim is to collaborate and prepare a small project by the end of the workshop that each group can  showcase at follow on events.

Hosted in the Workbench on Mainguard Street, our doors open at from 6pm to start the first workshops at 6:15pm, finishing at 9:00pm with food and coffee supplied throughout. We hope to see you all there, and please feel free to bring along friends and work colleagues.

Start your learning here - https://golang.org/

events.name: Cloud Next Extended

venue.name: PorterShed, Galway City Innovation District
venue.address_1: Eqre Square Galway (beside Meyrick + Bus Station)

events.description:
Next ‘17 will be the largest event in Google’s history. Google Cloud engineers, customers and partners will gather for inspiration and hands on experiences with tools, technologies and services born in the Cloud, including the latest developments from Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps and Devices. You don’t have to be in San Francisco to be part of history! Google Developers Group Galway Chapter are organizing Cloud Next Extended for you to join and get in on the action.

Join us in the PorterShed on the 20th of April for keynote highlights from the event in San Francisco, followed by CodeLabs in areas of your choice such as machine learning, bot development, web development, networking and of course, cloud! 

Free pizza provided on the night, kindly sponsored.

Feel free to share with your friends!

events.name: Google I/O - Extended

venue.name: PorterShed, Galway City Innovation District
venue.address_1: Eqre Square Galway (beside Meyrick + Bus Station)

events.description:
Join us for Google's biggest event of 2017!
We're expecting lots to look forward to after last year's announcements of Daydream, Home, and Android N to name but a few.

You can review the highlights from last year here:

https://www.youtube.com/embed/QPhXL1Im7ds

Bring your laptops along to experience the atmosphere of I/O from the comfort of the Portershed! We'll be streaming the main events live from Mountainview, CA, so you can follow along on the big screen or on your laptops in our Hub!

We've also prepared some games based around the event and networking within the community with some awesome prizes up for grabs (but I can't say much about these yet!) 

Follow along with the updates on our twitter channel @gdggalway and be the first to hear all our announcements!

events.name: Polymer Event - "Why Polymer"
events.description:
For those unable to travel to Copenhagen this August 22-23rd, GDG Galway will be bringing the best bits of the #PolymerSummit2017 to the PorterShed on August 29th.The event will start at 7 p.m. and end at 9 p.m.

If viewing the two days of talks, code labs, and breakout sessions from the Polymer team wasn’t enough for you, you can join our team for an evening of workshops and a specially prepared "Why Polymer" Keynote where our own Tech Lead, Julien Garrigues, will talk about how he uses Polymer, the transition to Polymer 2.0, and how these reusable Web Components have changed the game of Web Development and Progressive Web Apps for developers everywhere.

Our dedicated team of volunteers will be on hand to help during the workshops and we encourage students, beginners, and more seasoned developers alike to join us with great prizes up for grabs for all those taking part in our PWA workshop.

We are all hyped about the Polymer Summit in Copenhagen so whether you want to learn something completely new, brush up on your learning with new web technologies, or just chat to others about this year’s Summit; what the Polymer team has been working on since the release of Polymer 2.0, or its speakers from Google, Archilogic, Netflix, EA, Atlassian, and Ionic, join us on August 29th for two hours of code, chats, food and quiz games!

For those hearing about the wonder of Polymer for the first time and looking to know more:

Polymer is a JavaScript library that helps you create custom reusable HTML elements, and use them to build performant, maintainable apps.
https://www.polymer-project.org/ also offers hundreds of optimized Web elements that can be used in all sorts of web projects, big and small.

The Polymer Project is an open-source project led by a team of front-end developers working within the Chrome organization at Google. Their mission is to make life better for users and developers, by helping developers unlock the web platform’s full potential and by spurring the web platform to evolve and improve.

What’s not to like?

We can’t wait to show you some cool Polymer stuff! This is a great opportunity to meet sound people and network for pleasure or work.

We are looking forward to seeing you there!

-
Deirdre O’Connor
Tech, Social Media & Worskhop Development
Google Developers Group - Galway Chapter

NOTE: This event is officially supported by Google.

events.name: GDG Galway - Networking Event Sept. 2018
events.description:
The Google Developers Group - Galway Chapter is back again with another gathering of Tech aficionados in our lovely city of Galway!

We've been away for a few months, and we are sorry for that. However, the group in back on track to revitalize our community. It is the first event of a long series of networking gatherings!

For this first event in our new Networking Events series, we are inviting all people with interest in technology to join us at the WorkBench on the 5th of September.

During this fine night, you will have the opportunity to meet with people from a broad array of tech backgrounds from developers and designers to entrepreneurs and business people, to students eager to integrate the world of Technology and start their promising career.

We will get talking about hot topics in Technology and their current application in our industry like Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, Big Data, Cloud Computing, and more!

Bank of Ireland WorkBench is generously sponsoring this event with food and drinks for our attendees! As we get closer to the event, we will start promoting our food partner. Stay tuned!

We'd love for you to join us, enjoy the gathering and take part in an exciting networking session!

See you soon!
events.how_to_find_us: Ping us on Discord if you can't find the location

events.name: GDG Galway - Google Cloud Next '18 Extended
events.description:
The latest edition of Google Cloud Next will be live and broadcasted from London on October 10th and 11th. For those who won't be able to make it in person, we are organizing a rebroadcast of each day's keynote in the Bank of Ireland Startlab!

On the program this year, we have a section of talks around Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, IoT, deployment and CI processes, and more!

It will be a great opportunity to discover the latest updates in Google technologies and to share ideas and opinions on what the future has to offer!

Join us on October 10th and/or 11th between 7PM and 9PM at the Bank of Ireland Startlab in Mainguard Street for 2 evenings filled with tech talks!

In the meantime, you can find us on Twitter https://twitter.com/GDGgalway tweeting about all the latest techs and our upcoming events. You can also join our lovely community of tech enthusiasts on Discord https://discord.gg/JWNVT4W!

events.name: Dialogflow & Cloud AI {Demos/Workshops}
events.description:
The GDG Galway is starting 2019 with a new event focused on DialogFlow and Google Cloud AI products. The event will take place at the Bank of Ireland Innovation Lab in Mainguard Street on February 19th from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m.

------

The event will include two interesting demos:

- Demo 1 uses DialogFlow to create a simple chatbot responding to voice commands on the Google Home Assistant

<Break>

- Demo 2 combines multiple Google Cloud AI APIs such as Cloud Vision API and Cloud Natural Language API, to analyze text data to return the overall tone/mood of the document or to describe the content of a given image

-------

After the demos, we will gather for a cozy Q&A/Networking session around Technology and Google products where our organizers and mentors will be happy to answer your questions and chat more!

Don't forget to bring your laptops if you would like to follow the demos step by step and build your own prototypes.

Our team can't wait to see you all and welcome newcomers in our vibrant community! It's also a great opportunity to meet with Swapnil who recently joined the organizer's team.

Join our Discord to meet the community online as well and continue the chat!

See you soon,
The GDG Galway Organisers

events.name: Hash Code 2019

venue.name: J.E. Cairnes School of Business & Economics

events.description:
Another year, another Hash Code event hosted by NUIG in partnership with GDG Galway!

This year, our team partnered with NUIG to organise the competition in NUIG J.E. Cairnes building on February 28th between 5.30 p.m. and 9.30 p.m. We encourage you to arrive earlier to set your team and equipment.

If you haven't participated in a Hash Code before, the concept is simple, you will need to register before Feb 25, 2019 via this URL:
https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/register

HUB TO JOIN for GDG Galway:
Business Information Systems @ NUIG

SCHEDULE:
Feb 25, 2019 - Registration closes
Feb 28, 2019 (17:30 to 21:30 UTC) - Online Qualification Round
March 4, 2019 - Results announced
April 27, 2019 - Final Round

WHAT IS HASH CODE?
Google’s team-based programming competition, Hash Code, allows you to share your skills and connect with other coders as you work together to solve a problem modeled off a real Google engineering challenge! In small teams of two to four, coders all over the world will tackle the first problem through an Online Qualification Round. Though this round is hosted online, teams can come together to compete side-by-side in locally coordinated Hash Code hubs. The top teams from this round are invited to join us at an international Google office for our annual Hash Code Final Round.

HOW IT WORKS
Once you’ve registered for the contest, you’ll gain access to our Judge System. The Judge System is our online platform where you’ll form your team, join a hub, practice, and compete during the rounds. During the Online Qualification Round, you’ll watch Google's YouTube livestream to be introduced to the problem, and your team will have four hours to solve an optimization problem using the programming language and tools of your choice. Teams can compete from a local hub or another location of their choice. The top teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to the Final Round at a Google office, where they’ll work together to solve another challenge and compete for cash prizes.

Rules:
https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/rulesandterms

You will need your own laptops to participate! The venue will provide a solid Wi-Fi connection!

We can't wait to see you all and may the best coders win!

REGISTER HERE NOW:
https://codingcompetitions.withgoogle.com/hashcode/register

events.name: GDG Workshops - Firebase & Google Cloud AI
events.description:
We invite you to join us at the Portershed to participate in our latest workshop focused on Firebase products.

During this workshop, you will learn how to use services such as Firebase Authentication, Firestore, Storage, Hosting, Cloud Messaging, and Cloud Functions to help you build robust and scalable applications and microservices.

In our first demo, Julien will show you how to build an app similar to Google Photos using Firebase Authentication, Storage, Firestore and Hosting. We will also implement Google Cloud Vision API & Google Maps API to automatically categorize our pictures by date, location, and content.

For our second demo, Swapnil will demo how to build commercial products purely with SaaS (Software as a Service) using Firebase technology - Authentication, Database, Storage, Cloud Messaging and Analytics and how it can be integrated with Artificial Intelligence bots and Machine Learning algorithms.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2019
events.description:
The GDG Galway invites you to join them for this year's edition of Google I/O Extended!

Learn more about the topics that have been presented during the event, share your own experiences using Google products and participate in an interactive game to have a chance to win awesome prizes!

This year, the event will be hosted by the Portershed and food/beverages will be served to our attendees.

Register now and join the community!

events.name: GDG Galway - DevTalk Intro Session + NodeJS + ReactJS
events.description:
This is the start of a new series of events called DevTalks!

During these events, we will be focusing on developing your coding skills and knowledge about languages, frameworks, libraries, APIs, services and more! We are planning on hosting these events at the Galway Technology Centre in Mervue Business Park.

For this first DevTalk, we will give you a short introduction on what DevTalks are and how you too can participate!

Julien will chase this presentation with a codelab introducing NodeJS. We will go through the basics such as how to setup a new project and install dependencies, create a web server using ExpressJS, send requests to a third party API, and use template files with Mustache!

Rossano will talk about ReactJS, the new way to build user interfaces. For this first session he will cover simple and fundamental topics: basic concepts behind React and why it's so powerful, fragmentation of the UI into components, JSX and working with component's state and props.

Come ready to develop with us. Make sure you have nodejs installed and working before coming to the DevTalk so we can easily start code. Pick one of your favourite editors too. Rossano likes Visual Studio Code, for example. If you have any problem, don't worry. We're going to help you setting up the development environment!

There will be a short break between our two codelabs so you can enjoy some food and drinks, courtesy of our sponsor, the Galway Technology Centre!

We hope you will find the time to join us for the start of an epic series of events! And don't forget your laptops and chargers!

IMPORTANT NOTE: you can join our codelabs via video conference. We'll share the links with the attendees everytime.

The GDG Galway Team
events.how_to_find_us: You can take the 401 Bus Monivea Road stop // or 405 Bus Tuam Road stop

events.name: GDG Galway - DevTalk ReactJS + MongoDB + REST APIs
events.description:
Join our GDG Galway community for a new DevTalk session! This event will take place at the Galway Technology Centre in Mervue Business Park. Coffee and tea with biscuits will be served to our attendees courtesy of our fantastic venue!

On the program for this session, we will start with a codelab around MongoDB and REST APIs. During this codelab, we will install and configure MongoDB, query our database on NodeJS and build a simple API to read and write data to our database. We will also take this opportunity to discuss the differences between NoSQL and SQL, best practices when building a REST API and more!

Following this first codelab, we'll continue our trip into React with another codelab. We'll discuss component lifecycle methods, and we will perform some HTTP requests to fill our app with "external" data.

If you want to fully enjoy the experience, don't forget to bring your laptops and charges to be able follow our codelabs!

NOTE: This DevTalk will be streamed on our YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCa3x8UR18RSC1ZY2lM-eXZg) so you can also join our event remotely and chat with us!

We can't wait to see you all :)

The GDG Galway Team
events.how_to_find_us: You can take the 401 Bus Moonivea Road stop // or 405 Bus Tuam Road stop

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere feat. Kübra H. "What I learnt from a major sports brand app"
events.description:
Greetings everyone!

We are well into the summer, and it's time to take a fine refreshing beverage and join our upcoming event centered on the trendy Kotlin/Everywhere, featuring Kübra Harmankaya as our guest and speaker!

Kübra is GDG and WomenTechMaker lead since 2014. She will be traveling all the way from England to come to Galway and talk to us about her experience, and what she learned from major sports brands. She has contributed to many Android Apps for FC Barcelona, Premier League, FFA, British Council, General Electric and for many other companies.

It's a great opportunity for Galway community of developers to attend her talk and Code Lab at the Bank of Ireland Innovation Lab in Mainguard Street. Don't miss your chance to meet her and connect!

------------

TALK - WHAT I LEARNED FROM MAJOR SPORTS BRANDS
Kübra will be talking about her experience using Kotlin/Everywhere in production to build mobile applications and give us tips and tricks to manage a Kotlin project.

CODE LAB - REFACTORING TO KOTLIN
Together, with Kübra, we will follow-up with a code lab that will help us understand the concepts brought by Kotlin to build great Android Apps!

BRING YOUR LAPTOP!
As always, don't forget your laptops and chargers if you want to take part in our code lab!

WHAT SHOULD YOU HAVE INSTALLED ON YOUR LAPTOP?

IntelliJ IDEA
=> https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/

AND/OR

Android Studio
=> https://developer.android.com/studio/

------------

We hope to see you at the event and we can't wait to share a great time all together with our special guest Kübra speaking about Kotlin/Everywhere.

And as always, thank you for joining and supporting the GDG Galway community!

The GDG Galway Team

events.name: Google Cloud Talks with Richard Rose
events.description:
Richard Rose is a lab architect at Google Cloud, responsible for new technology (open source, gaming and infra). Working within the Training and Curriculum development team, he has a broad remit to play with all the technologies and defining tech best practice for his team. He also looks after the Cloud Hero platform, which is a gamification engine for learning GCP.

He will be showcasing some new stuff that he and his team are currently working on in Qwiklabs.

Kubernetes development – Cloud Code
Mobile development – Android
Game development – Top secret
Serverless development – Cloud Functions

This is a FREE event but places are limited and must be booked in advance. This event will fill quickly, limited space is available!

Event organized jointly between ITAG and GDG Galway.
Hosted in the innovation district in the Portershed.

ITAG EVENT LINK
https://www.itag.ie/event/tech-talks-with-richard-rose/

upcoming.name: Building an ARt Gallery in the Browser with Doug Sillars
upcoming.description:
For this exceptional talk and codelab, we will be welcoming Doug Sillars to our lovely stage!

He is a freelance mobile performance expert, having helped thousands of developers speed up their mobile apps and websites. A Google Developer Expert and the author of O’Reilly’s “High Performance Android Apps,” Doug regularly speaks at conferences, and blogs at dougsillars.com. He is currently working as a freelance digital nomad, traveling with his family in Europe.

The world of virtual reality allows us to build new 3D interactive spaces that we can fill with anything we want - like the art of the great Renaissance masters. More into Cubism? With a quick click - now the gallery is full of a completely different genre. With new AR features, we can actually build the gallery in our own space - and just as easily swap out the art - all in our browser!

In this talk, we’ll walk through the steps to build a virtual ARt gallery, with web technology available today, but also take a peek at the new WebXR technology that is coming to our browsers soon!

We will also take a nice break to enjoy some food and drinks courtesy of our generous sponsors!

NOTE: Don't forget your laptops and chargers if you want to take part in the Doug's codelab!

We can't wait to see you all at the event!

The GDG Galway Team

upcoming.name: Google Students Awareness Event
upcoming.description:
Details for the event will be available soon.
Stay tuned!

upcoming.name: DevTalk - The GDG Galway Website
upcoming.description:
We are back again with another DevTalk session!

In this DevTalk, we will be planning an exciting new project: our GDG Galway Website! From back-end to front-end, we will pick the technologies, tools, process, CI/CD using the same method that other open-source projects have.

The Community will be able to contribute so that we can build a beautiful home for our GDG Chapter!

This is a fantastic opportunity for young and experienced coders to work together on a fun and exciting project with new technologies and tools.

NOTE: You will also be able to join this session live on our YouTube channel! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCa3x8UR18RSC1ZY2lM-eXZg

As always, don't forget to bring your laptops and chargers!

We're super excited to kick-off this project with you all.

The GDG Galway Team
